knimeNode.name: RDKit SMILES Headers
knimeNode.shortDescription: Sets, changes and/or retrieves SMILES structures from RDKit table headers, which can be made visible using the RDKit Interactive View.

fullDescription.intro: Sets, changes and/or retrieves SMILES structures from RDKit table headers, which can be made visible using the RDKit Interactive View. It takes a data table as first input and optionally a SMILES definition table as second input. Based on the column names and SMILES of the second table it will manipulate the SMILES header values of the data table. If a column name in the data table matches a column name contained in the second input table, its SMILES value will be set to the SMILES value specified in the second input table. If the new value is empty or missing, the SMILES header information will be removed from the data table. This node delivers the manipulated table as first output table without changing any data inside the table. As second output table it produces a table with names and SMILES of all columns that have SMILES values set in their headers. This is useful if SMILES values shall be manipulated (e.g. canonicalized) and fed back in later to update the headers.
fullDescription.option: The input column of the second table that defines which data table column headers shall be changed.
The new SMILES values to be set for the specified data table columns. An empty or missing cell will remove the SMILES header information.

option.name: Complete reset of SMILES in all column headers

fullDescription.option: Flag this option to remove all existing SMILES values from all(!) header columns of the data table before (optionally) setting new SMILES values based on the second input table.

ports.inPort: Table whose SMILES header values shall be set, changed and retrieved.
Defines column names and SMILES to be set or changed.
ports.outPort: Same table as input data table, but with changed SMILES headers.
Table with all SMILES headers in result data table.

views.view: Displays the data in a table view. Has the capability to show chemical structures in the headers of the substructure count columns.
